content.question: ​The graph of the rational function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="x equals 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 4"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator x over denominator x squared minus 6 x plus 8 end fraction"><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator x over denominator x squared plus 6 x plus 8 end fraction"><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator x squared minus 6 x plus 8 over denominator x end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator x squared plus 6 x plus 8 over denominator x end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator x over denominator x squared minus 6 x plus 8 end fraction"><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
